text: Is there a way to permute the first two dimensions of an array that works regardless of how many total dimensions there are in the array?

elements.text: Is there a way to permute the first two dimensions of an array that works regardless of how many total dimensions there are in the array?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

What about something like this:
```a = 1:16 |> x -> reshape(x, 2, 2, 2, 2)
b = permutedims(a, [2, 1, 3:ndims(a)...])```
